articles.title: Leak confirms OpenAI's ChatGPT will integrate MCP
articles.description: ChatGPT is testing support for Model Context Protocol (MCP), which will allow the AI to connect to third-party services and use them as context.

articles.title: The #1 Juice for Gut Health, According to a Gastroenterologist
articles.description: A gastroenterologist swears by this juice because it’s rich in antioxidants and can help reduce inflammation in the gut.

articles.title: TUM researchers report record-setting battery electrolyte
articles.description: Researchers at the Technical University of Munich (TUM), in collaboration with TUMint.Energy Research, have set a new benchmark for solid-state battery electrolytes, introducing a lithium-antimony-scandium compound that shuttles lithium ions at 42 mS/cm.

articles.title: EA Announces Full Return To Office, Effectively Ending Remote Work
articles.description: Employees were reportedly told that "offsite local roles" will be gradually phased out.

articles.title: GTA 5 Has Sold An Absolutely Absurd Amount Of Copies In The Last Three Months
articles.description: Parent company Take-Two Interactive confirmed that Grand Theft Auto V has sold a staggering five million copies in the past three months.

articles.title: The Future of Mobile AI is Where Personalisation Meets Innovation
articles.description: A Q+A with Carl Nordenberg, VP, Mobile eXperience Business, Samsung Electronics Southeast Asia and Oceania

articles.title: The OnePlus Watch 3 Completes The OnePlus Mobile Ecosystem
articles.description: OnePlus has been building one of the most coherent and competitive ecosystems in the Android universe, and the Watch 3 helps this ecosystem stack up well against Samsung.

articles.title: Tim Sweeney is mocking Apple for letting Fortnite fakes into the App Store
articles.description: Epic Games has been waiting for Apple to approve Fortnite for the US iOS App Store for nearly a week, and Epic CEO Tim Sweeney is using X to try and put pressure on Apple, including with a post to Tim Cook.
